body:
Comment 4 by **russel.winder**: 
A friend of mine knew the answer to this immediately.  Years ago Debian (and BSD)
switched to having "net.ipv6.bindv6only = 1", Ubuntu still has this set to 0.  Not
working in both cases is apparently deemed to be a bug, with Java having been the
biggest name system to have had this bug.

So on Debian Testing with the value 1 (the default) things fail, with the value 0 it
works.  On Ubuntu, with the value 0 (the default) things work, with value 1 things fail
in exactly the same way they do on Debian.  So this is not an Ubuntu/Debian issue per se
but a Linux IPv6 related issue in Go.
